senses.ex: Water is a key element in this chemical reaction.

Tips.title: Not Exclusive
Tips.description: The word 'element' can be part of broader categories.
Tips.example: Color is an essential element of design, alongside shape and texture.

Tips.title: Abstract Concepts
Tips.description: 'Element' often introduces notions that aren't physically tangible.
Tips.example: Trust is a crucial element in a successful team.

Tips.title: Complex Systems
Tips.description: Used to describe one aspect of systems comprising many parts.
Tips.example: Price is just one element of the marketing mix.

senses.ex: Oxygen is an element on the Periodic Table.

Tips.title: Fixed Meanings
Tips.description: In chemistry, 'element' has a very specific scientific meaning.
Tips.example: Iron is a magnetic element essential to our blood cells.

Tips.title: Can't Break Down
Tips.description: An element is a substance that can't be broken down into simpler substances.
Tips.example: Helium is an element used in balloons and cannot be broken into anything simpler.

senses.ex: The fish is in its element in water.

Tips.title: Best Performance
Tips.description: Being 'in your element' means performing at your best due to favorable conditions.
Tips.example: The photographer is in her element when working in natural light.

Tips.title: Natural Setting
Tips.description: It suggests an ideal or habitual environment, emphasizing comfort or skill.
Tips.example: As a former teacher, he's in his element addressing large crowds.

senses.de: A group of people having common beliefs or occupation
senses.ex: There's a radical element in every society.

Tips.title: Common Traits
Tips.description: An element within a society often shares distinct common features or ideologies.
Tips.example: The youth element in the city is becoming more politically active.

Tips.title: Groups
Tips.description: Refers to a subset or fraction within a larger group or community.
Tips.example: The progressive element of the party seeks to change its policies.

senses.de: A part in an electrical device
senses.ex: The heating element in the oven burned out.

Tips.title: Specific Function
Tips.description: An element in electronics is designed for a particular functional role.
Tips.example: The resistive element in the circuit controls the flow of current.

Tips.title: Physical Component
Tips.description: Refers to a tangible part of an electrical system or device.
Tips.example: The kettle's heating element broke, so it no longer boils water.

Aspect.wordDefinition:
Aspect refers to a particular feature or quality of something, while the word element refers to a basic component or part of something.

For example, in a painting, one could refer to the color scheme, the brushwork, and the subject matter as aspects of the artwork.

Aspect is more often used to describe subjective or abstract qualities, while element describes more concrete, tangible parts or components.

Atom.wordDefinition:
An atom is the smallest unit of matter that retains the properties of an element. An element is a substance that is made entirely from one type of atom.

Atoms are applicable in the context of chemistry, where they determine the properties of molecules and compounds. Elements are applicable in the context of the periodic table, which shows the arrangement of elements according to their properties.

An atom is like a building block, while an element is like a pile of similar building blocks.

Component.wordDefinition:
Component refers to a part of a larger system or machine that can be easily separated and replaced. For example, the engine is a component of a car.

In summary, while both words refer to parts of something, component implies a replaceable part of a machine or system, while element is an inherent and essential building block.

Constituent.wordDefinition:
Both constituent and element are terms used to describe parts or components of something larger.

Constituent refers to a part or component that makes up a larger whole, such as a person who is a constituent of a political district or an ingredient that is a constituent of a recipe.

So, in essence, constituent emphasizes the importance of a part to a specific whole, while element emphasizes the fundamental nature of a part as a building block for various wholes.

Essence.wordDefinition:
Essence refers to the intrinsic nature or most important quality or characteristic of something. It's the thing that makes something what it is.

For example, the essence of a flower could refer to its fragrance or beauty.

Both words are applicable in many contexts, but generally, element refers to a more tangible or concrete aspect while essence refers to a more abstract or intangible aspect.

Factor.wordDefinition:
Factor refers to something that contributes to a result or outcome, such as a variable in a math equation or a factor that leads to success or failure.

An element is a basic building block, while a factor is a contributing cause. Elements are commonly used in the context of science and literature, while factors are often used in math and social sciences.

- In math, factors are used to break down a number into smaller parts, such as the factors of 12 being 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 12.

- In social sciences, socioeconomic status is often considered a factor that contributes to career success or failure.

Feature.wordDefinition:
Element generally refers to a basic part or component of something, while feature refers to a prominent or distinguishable aspect of something.

On the other hand, in software design, a feature refers to a specific functionality or characteristic of a program or application, such as the ability to save files or edit photos.

Element is applicable in scientific fields where the focus is on identifying and categorizing basic building blocks, while feature is more applicable in fields related to design or technology, where the focus is on developing and promoting specific characteristics or functionalities.

Ingredient.wordDefinition:
An ingredient is a component or substance that goes into a mixture or recipe to make something else. For example, flour, sugar, and eggs are ingredients that go into making a cake.

The difference between the two terms is that an element is a fundamental substance that is not made up of anything else, whereas an ingredient is a component of a larger substance or mixture.

Elements are typically discussed in the context of chemistry, while ingredients are more commonly used when discussing cooking or food.

Material.wordDefinition:
A material refers to any substance that can be used for a specific purpose, such as construction or manufacturing.

A material can be made up of more than one element or several compounds.

For example, concrete is a material that contains cement, sand, and gravel.

The term element is used in the context of chemistry or physics, whereas material is used more broadly in engineering and industrial applications.

Part.wordDefinition:
Part refers to a piece or section of something.

It can be a component, but not necessarily a fundamental one. For example, a car has parts like the wheels, the engine, and the seats.

Element is used when referring to basic components, while part is used when discussing any specific component of something, including basic components.

Your brain knows the truth, so you don't jump and you don't scream. It was very important for me to expose the audience to real elements.

quotes.Text: I like the idea of movies having a magic element. How many times have you seen an actor in a movie who you know only as the character? It's wonderful, isn't it?

quotes.Text: I love love, and I love life. I love. I just love. It's just great. It's the most enduring element we have is love.

quotes.Text: Suffering is the positive element in this world, indeed it is the only link between this world and the positive.
